questions.question: Who is considered the father of the computer?
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage designed the first mechanical computer, the Analytical Engine.

questions.question: What was the name of the first electronic digital computer?
questions.explanation: ENIAC was the first general-purpose electronic digital computer, completed in 1945.

questions.question: Which generation of computers used vacuum tubes?
questions.explanation: First generation computers used vacuum tubes for processing.

questions.question: What replaced vacuum tubes in second generation computers?
questions.explanation: Transistors replaced vacuum tubes in the second generation, making computers smaller and more reliable.

questions.question: Who developed the first compiler?
questions.explanation: Grace Hopper developed the first compiler for a programming language.

questions.question: What does the term 'bug' in computing originally refer to?
options: An actual insect causing a hardware malfunction
questions.explanation: The term originated when an actual moth caused a malfunction in the Harvard Mark II computer.

questions.question: Which company introduced the first personal computer?
questions.explanation: The Altair 8800 is considered the first successful personal computer.

questions.question: What year was the World Wide Web invented?
questions.explanation: Tim Berners-Lee invented the World Wide Web in 1989.

questions.question: Who co-founded Apple Computer?
questions.explanation: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak co-founded Apple Computer in 1976.

questions.question: What was the first programming language?
questions.explanation: Fortran, developed in the 1950s, was the first high-level programming language.
